perturbation.original_text: Distributor will comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including, without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, o r  b y contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will comply with all company policies and procedures. Distributor can find more information about these policies by contacting Cisco directly.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the explicit requirement for the distributor to comply with all applicable laws, including anti-corruption laws like the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. This omission could create a legal loophole, as the distributor may argue that their obligation is limited to Cisco's internal policies, even if those policies are not fully compliant with the law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and other applicable anti-corruption laws.

perturbation.original_text: (e) Distributor's key personnel who directly support Cisco's account have or will have completed training (provided by Distributor, Cisco Cisco's on-line anti-corruption training is available in numerous languages and is free of charge for up to five of Distributor's personnel at http://corpedia.com/clients/cisco/pre_reg.asp?lid-300446001., or another third party) on compliance with applicable anti-corruption laws within the past 12 months (from the date when this Agreement becomes effective);
perturbation.changed_text: (e) Distributor's key personnel who directly support Cisco's account may complete training on compliance with applicable laws.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'have or will have completed training' to 'may complete training,' the contract removes the mandatory training requirement. This weakens the due diligence expected of the distributor under anti-corruption laws. Making the training optional instead of mandatory reduces the distributor's accountability for compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and other applicable anti-corruption laws, which emphasize due diligence and training.

perturbation.original_text: (n) Notwithstanding any other provision in this Agreement, Cisco may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if Distributor breaches any of the representations and warranties set forth in this section.
perturbation.changed_text: (n) Cisco may terminate this Agreement with thirty days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes Cisco's explicit right to immediately terminate the agreement if the distributor breaches the representations and warranties related to compliance with laws. This is a legally required consumer right, because is important to preserve consumer safety, reduces legal risk, makes the contract non-compliant, and removes an important compliance measure. This weakens Cisco's ability to enforce compliance and potentially exposes them to liability if the distributor violates anti-corruption laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and general contract law principles related to material breach.
